description: Roman Villa complex dated by pottery to the 2nd - 4th CE. Just to the south is a chalk platform with a circular it cut into it. Inside the pit was placed a column base and altar during the later 4th CE. The structure, due to the presence of altar is suggested by the RSRB to be a shrine.
bibliography: Ette, J, and S Hinds. “Great Wilbraham Roman Villa and Fleam Dyke. Dungate Pipeline Scheme.” Cambridgeshire County Council Archaeological Field Unit Report No. 87 (1998). https://doi.org/10.5284/1021783.
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Great Wilbraham (Cambridgeshire).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
